result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Charles Van Lyssel

defendant.name: Van Lyssel, David Charles
defendant.address: 13487 W Gurno Lake Rd, Hayward, WI 54843

records.addlTxt:
VOLUNTARY APPEARANCE

Uploaded served warrant document from ShareFile. No Card to pull to send to Sheriff's Department. 

Canceled Warrant with Dispatch -  Dispatch has not received warrant -  Deputy Villiard will call when canceled.   Verified at 12:02 PM 10/12/2022 warrant canceled

10:55 AM Defendant David Charles Van Lyssel in court.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF makes statement as to missed appearance.  Warrant quashed.   DEF has filed paperwork for court appointed attorney.   DEF requests to have attorney present.   Court reset.   Court reinstate bond  CBS $500   Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Initial appearance scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Uploaded warrant document to ShareFile and sent paper copy to Sheriff's Department.  No warrant card generated.

11:36 AM Defendant David Charles Van Lyssel not in court.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  State requests warrant and bail forfeiture proceedings.   Court grants request.  Warrant authorized (Wisconsin and Surrounding States) as requested and bail forfeiture to begin.
Bail/Bond Review scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Do Not operator motor vehicle without a valid driver license.
	
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  
	
Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843   Phone:  715-804-0109 or 715-961-0149  for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

VAN LYSSEL,  DAVID      CASE: 22100227

Vehicle Operate Flee/Elude Officer
Reckless Driving-Endanger Safety
OAR
Bail/bond hearing on October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:02 AM DE David Van Lysselin court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Gabriel Pollak (special appearance) appears by video. Kenneth Sortedahl appeared by video for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE does not qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.   Court has discussion with victim H. B. I, and victim wishes to waive no contact recommendation.   Atty Pollak argues bond.  Court gives the DE the attorney colloquy. Court sets bond.  Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for 10/10/2022  at 11:00AM.
